content.rendered:
Qualifying to Participate in a Commencement Ceremony

Once master’s students have applied for advanced standing in a degree program, a commencement eligibility analysis will be performed during each subsequent commencement period.

 

Master’s students qualify and will be cleared to participate in a commencement ceremony when:

All degree-applicable coursework has been completed

  • When degree is completed at the end of  Summer  term or Fall term, or January Interterm, student will qualify and be cleared to participate in the  Spring Commencement Ceremony.

 

A student is registered in all coursework that would complete the degree

  • When a student is registered in all coursework that will complete the degree during Spring term, student will be cleared for the Spring Commencement Ceremony.
  • La Verne Holds one commencement ceremony each year in Spring, usually at the end of May.
